questions.question: What is the primary function of a multiplexer (MUX) in digital logic?
options: Select one of many input signals to pass to a single output.
Store a single bit of information.
Perform arithmetic addition on two binary numbers.
Convert a parallel input into a serial output.
Generate a clock signal for synchronous circuits.

questions.question: Which characteristic primarily defines the Von Neumann architecture for computer systems?
options: Separate memory spaces and buses for instructions and data.
A single shared memory space and bus for both instructions and data.
Exclusive use of multiple processing cores for parallel execution.
Specialized hardware units dedicated solely to I/O operations.
Strict in-order execution of all instructions.

questions.question: In the context of advanced functional verification for complex System-on-Chip (SoC) designs, which methodology framework is widely adopted for creating reusable, scalable, and robust testbenches, often incorporating constrained-random stimulus generation and coverage-driven verification?
options: Static Timing Analysis (STA)
Design Rule Checking (DRC)
Universal Verification Methodology (UVM)
Layout Versus Schematic (LVS)
Electrical Rule Checking (ERC)

questions.question: In a pipelined processor, what technique is used to speculatively guess the outcome of a conditional branch instruction to minimize pipeline stalls and keep the pipeline full, often before the actual branch condition is resolved?
options: Operand forwarding (bypassing)
Register renaming
Branch prediction
Data prefetching
Memory-mapped I/O

questions.question: What is the primary role of photolithography in the fabrication of integrated circuits?
options: To deposit thin layers of conductive or insulating materials onto the wafer.
To selectively remove material from the wafer surface using etchants.
To transfer geometric patterns from a photomask onto the photosensitive resist on a wafer.
To electrically test the finished chips for defects.
To polish and flatten the wafer surface after deposition steps.
